DataElement.preferredName: Person Blood Genetic Testing Consent Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether or a not a participant agrees to donate some of their tissue material for future research which may include genetic testing.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A human being.:A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder._Permission to do something.

Property.preferredDefinition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood._The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder._Permission to do something.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The process of isolating and testing the DNA of an embryo or a person to detect the presence of genetic alterations or defects that may predispose to the future development of a disease or disorder.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: patients' acknowledgement and acceptance of participation in a clinical trial.

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Response Terminology Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Yes No Unknown or Not Applicable Response within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the participant agree to donate blood to the ACSR for future research that may include genetic testing to learn about, prevent, diagnose, or treat HIV-related diseases and/or cancer(s)?
